source.d56a8f7b:
# Uploading kaggle.json
from google.colab import files
files.upload()
source.423c0952:
# Check if you upload successful
!ls -lha kaggle.json
# Output: -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 63 Aug  8 11:17 kaggle.json

# Install kaggle package
!pip install -q kaggle
source.b4146bc7:
# check kaggle datasets. If it appears, you have done it right
!kaggle datasets list
source.a948177e:
# Start to download the dataset
!kaggle competitions download landmark-recognition-2020
source.5f59009f:
And there you have downloaded the dataset from the competition.
If you have any problems, just comments and I will try my best to support!
source.bdbd4960:
This kernel provide you a simple way to download the competition's dataset to your Colab.
Follows the steps and you will be ready!
source.2442e3ae:
Get your API Token in 'My Account'.
Click 'Create new API Token', you will get a file named 'kaggle.json'. If you already have one, click 'Expire API Token'.
